description.narrative:
The LPI Multi-Level Conflict Transformation initiative aims at contributing to a stable and peaceful Somalia by supporting inclusive reconciliation processes that address local grievances and root causes of conflict. South Central Somalia continues to face substantial obstacles in the nations quest for peace and stability. The targeted conflict systems are not only hotspots of historic and recurrent violent clan-based conflict but have also been negatively impacted by top-down state-building processes and contribute to instability in South Central Somalia. In this light, LPIs programming will focus on addressing persistent or recurring local-level clan conflicts. LPIs partnership with wellconnected and experienced civil society partners will seek to create space for dialogue, negotiation and, ultimately, agreements as well as new collective behaviour to address clan-based, local level conflicts that receive little or no attention in the global and regional policy narratives, yet nevertheless are intricately connected to these other layers.
LPIs three organizational strategic priorities include civil society support and inclusive engagement for peace, policy engagement and awareness-raising, and knowledge and learning to enhance practice, will function as an overarching framework for programming. The programme will build upon results achieved under the previous phase of the programme implemented between 2017 to 2019.
The overall objective of the programme is to: contribute to a stable and peaceful Somalia by supporting inclusive reconciliation processes that address local grievances and root causes of conflict.
LPI proposes to allocate funding for Phase 2 for the next four years from 2020 - 2023 according to 4 outcome areas:
Outcome 1: Local conflict actors collaborate and nonviolently on conflict Outcome 2: Strengthening meaningful inclusion and participation in peacebuilding Outcome 3: Local authorities as peacebuilding supporters Outcome 4: Policy actors actions to create a more conducive environment for peace

Konfliktlösningsinitiativet Multi-Level Conflict Transformation i södra och mellersta Somalia 2020-2023, genomfört av Life & Peace Institute (LPI), syftar till att bidra till ett stabilt och fredligt Somalia genom att stödja en inkluderande försoningsprocess med fokus på lokala problem och konflikternas orsaker. Programmet kommer att fokusera på ihållande eller återkommande klankonflikter på lokal nivå. Programmet kommer att genomföras 2020–2023 med en total budget på 94.35 MSEK, varav 48 MSEK kommer från Sida. LPI:s Huvudfokus kommer att vara kapacitetsuppbyggande av civilsamhället, inklusive kvinnor och unga, påverkansarbete mot beslutsfattare inom samhället, lokal administration och nationell styrning, att utveckla och stärka konfliktlösningsmekanismer samt främja en kultur där forskning och kunskap kan spridas.

The Multi-Level Conflict Transformation in South Central Somalia 2020-2023 initiative by the Life & Peace Institute (LPI) aims at contributing to a stable and peaceful Somalia by supporting inclusive reconciliation processes that address local grievances and root causes of conflict. The programme will focus on addressing persistent or recurring local-level clan conflicts. The programme will be implemented from 2020 to 2023 with a total budget of approximately 94.35 MSEK, of which 48 MSEK will be funded by Sida. Key focuses for LPI will be capacity building for civil society, including women and youth advocacy’s towards decision making positions within the community, local administration and national government, developing and strengthening conflict prevention mechanisms and promotion of a culture of research and knowledge sharing.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 1.5 - By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters.

1.5 - Till 2030 bygga upp motståndskraften hos de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer och minska deras utsatthet och sårbarhet för extrema klimatrelaterade händelser och andra ekonomiska, sociala och miljömässiga chocker och katastrofer.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

16.a - Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

16.a - Stärka berörda nationella institutioner, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete, i syfte att bygga upp kapacitet på alla nivåer, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, för att förebygga våld och bekämpa terrorism och brottslighet.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

title.narrative: 13778 - 1st amendment to the Agreement LPI Somalia Programme

description.narrative:
The report covered 2020 achievements as per the signed agreement. Below are the achievements:
- Peace agreements of 5 inter-clan and 1 intra-clan have been reached and sustained through dialogue and negotiation among key stakeholders of conflicting groups that resulted in reduction of clashes, improved resource sharing, demobilization of militias and acceptance of community policing. - The Kismayo Women Platform taking lead in inter-clan reconciliation and Somali Womens Solidarity Organisation brought 69 participants 17 women from the Ogaden clan, 17 women from Marehan clan, 10 elders from both clans, 10 religious leaders, 10 women platform members, and 5 government officials. - Jubbaland Womens platform established composing of 25 women and female youth established in Kismayo, Jubbaland. The Jubbaland Womens Platform and Jubbaland Youth were trained on advocacy, leadership, and good governance. - Peacebuilding Platforms have conducted 3 emergency crisis interventions in Hiraan, Galgadud and Kismayo. - More than 70 % of sustained dialogue(SD) participants increased perception on their agency in peacebuilding in all the project.A total of 385 SD sessions conducted in 3 location- Abudwak, Jowhar and Baidoa. - More than 50% of local administration actively participated in peacebuilding process organized by the project participants and 5 advocacy meeting between platforms and key local authorities i.e district and regional administrations were conducted in Kismayo, Dollow, Hiran, Galgadud and Middle Shabelle.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
